title: Hint 1: Understanding Enthalpy
text: Enthalpy is a state function, which means its change only depends on the initial and final states of a system, not on the path taken.

title: Scaffold 1: Isothermal Process
text: During an isothermal process, what happens to the temperature of the gas?

title: Hint 2: Adiabatic Process
text: In an adiabatic process, there is no heat transfer between the system and its surroundings.

title: Scaffold 2: Adiabatic Expansion
text: If the process is adiabatic, does heat enter or leave the system?

title: Hint 3: Reversible Process
text: A reversible process is an ideal process that happens infinitely slowly, allowing the system to remain in equilibrium.

title: Scaffold 3: Reversible Compression
text: What does a reversible isothermal compression imply about the system and surroundings' temperature?

title: Hint 4: Heat Exchange
text: The gas returns to its initial state A after a heat exchange, completing the cycle.

title: Scaffold 4: Net Change in Enthalpy
text: Since the gas returns to its initial state A, what can you infer about the net change in enthalpy (ΔH)?
